properties.name: Feeding Hummingbird
properties.description: Large metal sculpture approximately 9 feet high featuring a hummingbird feeding from a flower.

properties.name: Embracing Peace
properties.description: Embracing Peace captures the jubilance of Americans on V-J Day, August 14, 1945. It honors the memory of the past, reminding us of the sacrifice of a nation, and awakening younger generations to the heroic stories of America’s Greatest Generation. This sculpture has been featured in various cities across the United States from Florida to California, as well as in Times Square, NYC, Rome, Italy and Civitavecchia, Italy. A casting of the sculpture has also been on display in Normandy, France and is currently sited at the Bastogne War Museum in Belgium.

properties.name: Moby
properties.description:
Artist Mike Roig lives and works in Carrboro, where he maintains
the Heartworks Studio. Roig is a graduate from the University
of Maryland where he earned Bachelor of Arts in Studio Art
with concentrations in drawing, sculpture and printmaking.

properties.name: The Sunflower Building
properties.description:
Local mural artist Davis — he prefers to go by just the one name — is painting a giant sunflower on the side of 102 W. Elm St., Graham, what some neighbors are now calling “the Sunflower building.”

He painted the leaves and petals “free hand,” or without a grid, but the seeds, he said, are patterned on two spirals based on the Fibonacci sequence, what Davis called “sacred geometry.” He said he would probably draw a grid on the wall first for that part to reproduce it from a smaller drawing.

Davis said he has a number of local murals, including the one on the side of the Five Star building in Mebane.

properties.name: Love Graham
properties.description:
The hearts of different colors with different messages make up the background. Since the festival in May, Feudale, Garton, Davis, Melody Bodkin and Eastern Alamance High School art teacher Lauri Daughtry have been working, as volunteers, on the garden at the center of the mural.

“The concept is to signify how, when community comes together, we can grow Graham into a beautiful city,” Feudale said. “So it’s to signify growth.”
properties.artist: Audrey Garton, Davis Davis, Molly Feudale, Melody Bodkin, et al.
